at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection.Connection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GamepadConnection, ServerConnection

    public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    The Connection-class is a base-class for each and every external device that communicates with the RMCS and therefore the Raspberry-Pi.
    It provides basic tools for forwarding SensorData and accessing ControlData.
    Listeners are able to register themselves with the ServerConnection to get updated about sending and receiving data as well as connection updates.
    Author:
    Boeck

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long connectionId
      the ID of this connection.
      protected long connectionIdInCameraControl
      holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the camera-control-data of the RMCS.
      protected long connectionIdInDriveControl
      holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the drive-control-data of the RMCS.
      protected long connectionIdInLightControl
      holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the light-control-data of the RMCS.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue
      the queue that is used to signal the main thread to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue
      the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.
      private static long id
      static variable to ensure every connection has a unique id.
      private java.util.Collection<IUI> uis
      the list of IUIs that want to know about the gamepads status

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connection(long carId, java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue, java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue)
      A simple constructor with the minimal set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
      Sets connectionId to the current value of id and increments id.
      The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets cannot be set here and need to be set after instantiation, via updateControllingDevice(ControlChangeQueueElement) or {link updateControllingDevice(long, EDataType).
      Connection(long carId, java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue, java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue, long connectionIdInDriveControl, long connectionIdInLightControl, long connectionIdInCameraControl)
      A constructor with the maximum set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
      Sets connectionId to the current value of id and increments id.
      The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets are set via their corresponding parameters.

    • Field Detail

      • id

        private static long id
        static variable to ensure every connection has a unique id. First device has an ID of 1.

      • connectionId

        private long connectionId
        the ID of this connection. Required to handle connections in the main class. First device has an ID of 1.

      • connectionIdInDriveControl

        protected long connectionIdInDriveControl
        holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the drive-control-data of the RMCS.

      • connectionIdInLightControl

        protected long connectionIdInLightControl
        holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the light-control-data of the RMCS.

        holds the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the camera-control-data of the RMCS.

        the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.

      • controlChangeQueue

        private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue
        the queue that is used to signal the main thread to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(long carId,
                  java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue,
                  java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue)
        A simple constructor with the minimal set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
        Sets connectionId to the current value of id and increments id.
        The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets cannot be set here and need to be set after instantiation, via updateControllingDevice(ControlChangeQueueElement) or {link updateControllingDevice(long, EDataType).
        Parameters:
        carId - The ID that the RMCS registers itself with on the Server.
        controlDataQueue - the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.
        controlChangeQueue - the queue that is used to signal the main class to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.

      • Connection

        public Connection(long carId,
                  java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> controlDataQueue,
                  java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement> controlChangeQueue,
                  long connectionIdInDriveControl,
                  long connectionIdInLightControl,
                  long connectionIdInCameraControl)
        A constructor with the maximum set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
        Sets connectionId to the current value of id and increments id.
        The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets are set via their corresponding parameters.
        Parameters:
        carId - The ID that the RMCS registers itself with on the Server.
        controlDataQueue - the queue that is used to send ControlData to their corresponding interfaces.
        controlChangeQueue - the queue that is used to signal the main class to change the connection that is currently under control of a specific control-data-set.
        connectionIdInDriveControl - the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the drive-control-data of the RMCS.
        connectionIdInLightControl - the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the light-control-data of the RMCS.
        connectionIdInCameraControl - the ID of the connection that is currently controlling the camera-control-data of the RMCS.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionId

        public long getConnectionId()
        Returns:
        this connections ID.

      • getUIs

        protected java.util.Collection<IUI> getUIs()
        Returns:
        the list of UIs that are registered with this object.

      • updateUIs

        protected abstract void updateUIs(EIdentifier identifier,
                                  java.lang.String message)
        Updates all registered UIs with the latest status of this connection.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the topic of the message.
        message - the message that the UIs should be updated with.

      • registerUI

        public void registerUI(IUI ui)
        Registers a new UI.
        Parameters:
        ui - the UI to be registered.

      • updateControllingDevice

        public boolean updateControllingDevice(long connectionIdInControl,
                                       EDataType dataType)
        Used to update connectionIdInDriveControl, connectionIdInDriveControl and connectionIdInDriveControl, depending on the dataType that was passed.
        Parameters:
        connectionIdInControl - the new ID that is currently in control of the specified control-data.
        dataType - the control-data-type the specified ID is currently in control of.
        Returns:
        true, if the passed dataType is valid and the corresponding control-ID updated, otherwise false.

      • updateControllingDevice

        public boolean updateControllingDevice(ControlChangeQueueElement queueElement)
        Used to update connectionIdInDriveControl, connectionIdInDriveControl and connectionIdInDriveControl, depending on the dataType that was passed.
        Parameters:
        queueElement - contains information about device in control and type of control-data.
        Returns:
        true, if the passed dataType in the queueElement is valid and the corresponding control-ID updated, otherwise false.

      • changeControllingDevice

        protected boolean changeControllingDevice(long connectionId,
                                          EDataType dataType)
        Informs the main-thread of a change in control of a certain type of control-data via the controlChangeQueue.
        Parameters:
        connectionId - the ID that should be in control of the specified control-data.
        dataType - the control-data-type the specified ID should be in control of.
        Returns:
        true, if the controlChangeQueue was successfully updated, otherwise false.

      • putControlData

        protected boolean putControlData(IControlData data)
        Checks, if this object is in control of the passed control-data-type and if so, tries to update the controlDataQueue with the passed IControlData.
        Parameters:
        data - the element that the controlDataQueue should be updated with.
        Returns:
        true, if this object is in control of the passed IControlData and the controlDataQueue was successfully updated.

      • waitMs

        protected void waitMs(int ms)
        Helper-method to remove overhead from other places, where a specified amount of milliseconds should be waited.
        Parameters:
        ms - the amount of milliseconds that should be waited.
